tests: Add README for fuzzing and a stats target
candidates.body: Add a README that explains how to setup and run fuzzing and add another target for the `Memcached::stats()` method.

candidates.title: tests: Introduce fuzz testing and fix issues identified
candidates.body: Add fuzz testing for some DNS parsing methods and Memcached methods. This change also fixes an issue with large payloads returned by Memcached servers that could overflow a `usize` integer.

candidates.body: Add lints to the client and main crates and update to Rust 1.87 locally (which is responsible for all the import reordering)

candidates.title: test: Add DNS Name benchmarks
candidates.body: Use criterion to benchmark DNS Name methods

labels.name: packaging
labels.description: Relating to build process or artifacts

candidates.title: Version bump for 0.10.0 release
Allow DNS SRV records to be use to discover cache servers
candidates.body:
Adds support for discovering Memcached servers using DNS SRV records via the `dnssrv+` prefix on hostnames supplied for `mtop` and `mc`.

Part of #107

candidates.title: Update to latest version of cargo-dist
Implement a rudimentary DNS client for SRV record lookup
candidates.body:
This change creates a very basic DNS client capable of performing A, AAAA, CNAME, NS, SOA, TXT, and SRV types of queries. This is the first step in supporting DNS lookup of SRV records for service discovery in `mtop` and `mc`. It also adds a `dns` executable capable of making queries and parsing binary DNS messages.

This client has undergone very little testing and should be considered both experimental and internal to mtop.

See #107

candidates.title: Dependency updates
Version bump for 0.9.0 release
Fix tab overflow from lots of hosts
candidates.body:
Allow all host tabs to be displayed even when there are more hosts than can fit on the screen. This fix is a bit of a cheat since we aren't actually moving the tabs, we just change the order of hosts based on user input. If this proves annoying to use we can look at actually moving the tabs around.

Fixes #117

candidates.title: Version bump for 0.8.0 release
Profiling support and performance improvements
candidates.body:
This change adds build-time support for collecting pprof profiling data when using the `mc` binary. Along with this, are a few performance improvements that came out of profiling.

* Don't do health checks on get or puts of connections by default. They're unnecessary most of the time and dramatically slow down benchmarks.
* Make the "score" used by rendezvous hashing simpler, just the hash of the server and key instead of taking the logarithm.
* Use a for-loop for scoring each server as part of server selection so that we don't compute the score for a particular server more than once.

Fixes #112

candidates.title: Add support for `mc bench` command to benchmark servers

labels.name: area:mc
labels.description: Relating to the mc CLI tool

candidates.body:
Add support for running simplistic benchmarks against a Memcached server. The purpose of the command is to provide an easy way to send _some_ amount of traffic to a server, not provide a comprehensive benchmark tool.

Fixes #109

candidates.title: Dependency updates
Introduce high-level MemcachedClient
candidates.body:
Create a high-level client that interacts with multiple Memcached servers depending on the key or operation being performed. The client uses rendezvous hashing to determine which server is responsible for any relevant keys.

In addition the following improvements have been made:
* `Key` type introduced to validate keys before using them
* `mc` has been rewritten to clean up resources properly

The following things are missing and will done in follow up work:
* Tests for newly introduced client and hashing
* Type-safe alternative to string hostnames
